snippet: Gov. Pat McCrory said the lawsuit over the state’s restrictive voter identification laws, filed on Monday by the Justice Department, was rooted in politics.
abstract: Gov Pat McCrory of North Carolina pushes back against Obama administration, saying that lawsuit by Justice Department over state's restrictive voter identification laws is politically influenced overreach; Justice Department filed suit challenging four parts of state's broad new voter laws.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Pat McCrory said the lawsuit over the state’s restrictive voter identification laws, filed on Monday by the Justice Department, was rooted in politics.

headline.main: North Carolina Governor Assails Suit on Voting Laws
headline.print_headline: North Carolina Governor Assails Suit on Voting Laws
